You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

translation.title: Five Discourses on Not Seeing Form, Etc.

next.name: Five Discourses on Not Comprehending Form, Etc.

segments.en: 6–10. Five Discourses on Not Seeing Form, Etc.

segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo, yānimāni anekavihitāni diṭṭhigatāni loke uppajjanti—
segments.en: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why these various misconceptions arise in the world? …”

segments.pli: sassato lokoti vā, asassato lokoti vā … pe …
neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇāti vā”ti?

segments.en: “Vaccha, it is because of not seeing form …

segments.pli: viññāṇe kho, vaccha, adassanā … pe … viññāṇanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya adassanā … pe ….
segments.en: consciousness, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation …”

suttaplex.blurb: The wanderer Vacchagotta asks the Buddha why the various speculative views come to be. The Buddha replies that it is because of not seeing the five aggregates.
suttaplex.translated_title: Five Discourses on Not Seeing Form, Etc.
